UserProfile.title: User Profile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user's profile in the application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile, matching the Firebase Auth UID.

preferredLanguage.description: User's preferred language for the application interface.

score10th.description: User's score or percentage in 10th grade.

score12th.description: User's score or percentage in 12th grade.

distance.description: Distance of the user's home from the hostel, in kilometers.

amenities.description: List of amenities offered by the hostel.

feeStructure.description: Fee structure details of the hostel.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a review given by a resident for a hostel.

userDisplayName.description: Denormalized display name of the user who wrote the review.

userPhotoURL.description: Denormalized photo URL of the user who wrote the review.

imageUrl.description: URL of an image attached to the review.

Room.title: Room
Room.description: Represents a room in a hostel.

availability.description: Availability status of the room (e.g., available, occupied, maintenance).

Wishlist.title: Wishlist
Wishlist.description: Represents a user's wishlist for hostels, which also functions as a waiting list.

id.description: Unique identifier for the wishlist item.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the hostel was added to the wishlist. Used for waiting list order.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure, scalable, and easily debuggable system for HostelVerse, focusing on authorization independence and clear access patterns. We are leveraging Structural Segregation to isolate user profiles and hostel data, applying path-based ownership for user-specific data and the Membership Map pattern for collaborative data. UserProfile: User profiles are stored under `/users/{userId}/profile/{userId}` to establish clear ownership and simplify security rules. The `userId` parameter in the path directly corresponds to the authenticated user's ID, ensuring that only the user can access and modify their profile. Hostel: Hostels are stored in a flat `/hostels` collection. Reviews, Rooms are stored in subcollections. The `members` map enables collaborative authorization. Reviews: Reviews are stored in a `/hostels/{hostelId}/reviews/{reviewId}` subcollection, reflecting the 1:N relationship between Hostels and Reviews. Authorization is managed via the `userId` field in the review, ensuring only the author or hostel members can manage the review. Rooms: Rooms are stored in a `/hostels/{hostelId}/rooms/{roomId}` subcollection to represent the 1:N relationship between Hostels and Rooms. Wishlist: Wishlist items are stored under `/users/{userId}/wishlist/{wishlistId}`, clearly associating each wishlist with a user. Authorization Independence: Authorization Independence is achieved by storing the user's role directly within the document, eliminating the need for complex `get()` calls to parent documents in security rules. This approach supports atomic operations and enhances security rule debuggability. QAPs (Rules are not Filters): The structure supports secure list operations through structural segregation. Private user data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, allowing simple rules to restrict access based on the authenticated user's ID. Public hostel data in `/hostels` can have more permissive rules while still maintaining security. DBAC (Database-Based Access Control): The membership map is used for collaborative data, offering flexibility in defining roles and permissions without relying on custom claims.
